p: Danger can be defined internally from a bottom-up approach and is then made real by the peopleâ€™s perception, in contrast to an external scientific valuation (Hulme 2011:193). In this manner, risk perception happens within a social network. If it differs from the external valuation, a gap in communication can be identified. Perception of capacity is pivotal for action. Wolf ( 2011:25) warns about inaction when either the perception of individual agency or controllability is low.
